transcript.text: How good are you at recognizing risky situations? Read this scenario, select Agree or Disagree for each option, then click on Submit.

contentText.text: A consultant you work with in the Middle East tells you that the import duty for a shipment was high but he found “a cheaper solution” and the shipment has now been released. Which of these statements do you agree with?

instructionText.text: Select Agree or Disagree for each option then click on Submit.
Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

option.text: This “cheaper solution” could involve someone being paid a bribe
You should report your suspicions to your manager or the Law Department
You should wait and see what happens, and then discuss with your manager
If the consultant has paid a bribe on our company’s behalf, he would be held responsible, not Johnson Controls
You should thank the consultant for saving money and channel more work his way in the future

correct.text: The “cheaper solution” could be a bribe. Sometimes bribery can be very subtle. In such a situation, you should report your suspicions immediately to your manager and a member of the Legal or Compliance Department, or report your concern to the Integrity Helpline.
If a third party pays a bribe on behalf of Johnson Controls, we are still liable.

incorrect.text: The “cheaper solution” could be a bribe. Sometimes bribery can be very subtle. In such a situation, you should report your suspicions immediately to your manager and a member of the Legal or Compliance Department, or report your concern to the Integrity Helpline.
If a third party pays a bribe on behalf of Johnson Controls, we are still liable.
